result.execSummary:
The defendant David P. Prill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David P. Prill is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David P. Prill was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • David P. Prill was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Robert Keller.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:53am-  Matter heard with 13CM1059.  Victim rights compliance.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of no contest to counts 2 & 3; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, count 1 is dismissed.  Court orders a $200.00 fine plus costs & DNA surcharge on each count - to be taken from bond on deposit.  Court signs bond assignment.  Remaining balance to be returned to Attorney Keller.  Appeal rights given.

ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Robert Keller.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  2:41pm-  Victim rights compliance.  Attorney Keller is requesting an adjournment as he recently spoke w/ ADA Zapf today.  State does not object.  Court grants request.  Final pre-trial adjourned to October 2, 2014 at 09:30 am.  Bond continued.
Final pre-trial on August 18, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Due to ongoing jury trial (State v. Martinez), 6/24/2014 Final pre-trial is rescheduled to 8/18/2014 at 3pm.  NTBS by the Court.

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Robert Keller.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:36am-  FILE NOT IN COURT.  Victim rights compliance.  Attorney Keller is requesting an adjournment for reasons set forth on the record.  Discussion held re: the bond assignment received by the Court.  Court defers taking any action on the bond assignment pending the resolution of this case.  Final pre-trial adjourned to June 24, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Bond continued.

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Robert Keller. Clerk LE. Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 5-12-14 @ 10:30am. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing
Judge Wilk does not sign bond assignments until the conclusion of a case.  Bond assignment paperwork placed in the file.
Bond assignment received from Atty. Keller; sent to Br.7 for Judge's signature.  kmk
Deft has retained Atty. Robert Keller on 4/17/14.  kmk

Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Comm Mason on 4/30/14 @ 9 a.m.  Fax received from Atty Keller saying he has been retained and requesting preliminary hearing. Bond - Continued posted
Preliminary hearing on April 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Deft walked out the door without signing the Notice of Hearing.
